name: There Will Be Fireworks - The Dark Dark Bright (CD Album)
description:
Release Date: 25/11/2013

There Will Be Fireworks like to take their time with things. Made up of five school and university friends from Glasgow, the band self-released their debut album in 2009 to much critical acclaim, slowly amassing a cult following for their unique blend of pop, folk and post-rock. Producer Marshall Craigmyle (Old Mill Studios, Strathaven) has been instrumental in helping develop the band's sound, taking the helm on the self-titled debut record, 2011's Because, Because EP and stunning sophomore full-length album The Dark, Dark Bright.

TRACKLIST:

1. And Our Hearts Did Beat
2. River
3. Roots
4. Youngblood
5. Ash Wednesday
6. So Stay Close
7. Lay Me Down
8. Here Is Where
9. Your House Was Aglow
10. South Street
11. Elder And Oak
12. The Good Days

Catalogue Number: CAC007

name: Blood Relatives - Deerheart (Digital Single)
description:
Release Date: 09/09/2013
Catalogue Number: CAC006

The lead single from the Paul Savage produced Blood Relatives debut album 'Deerheart', out on Comets & Cartwheels 28/10/2013.

Pre-order to receive direct to your inbox on day of release.

TRACKLIST:
1. Deerheart

name: Blood Relatives - Deerheart (Digital Album)
description:
Release Date: 28/10/2013

Blood Relatives are a Glasgow-based band who play songs in an effort to make you dance and make you think. Having played together for a number of years under various guises and appearing at festivals such as T In The Park, Wickerman, Rockness, and Belladrum, the band release their Creative Scotland funded debut on Comets & Cartwheels this October.

Produced by Paul Savage (Admiral Fallow, The Delgados, The Phantom Band) and mastered by Iain Cook (Chvrches, The Unwinding Hours), the record showcases the band at their most mature, blending a uniquely Scottish sense of humour with sunny pop hooks that detract from the dreary climate of their homeland.

TRACKLIST:

1. Fowl Mouth 
2. Deerheart 
3. Bone Idol 
4. A Murder Of Crows 
5. Dead Hip 
6. Cold Fish 
7. Bird Flu 
8. Duck! 
9. Cheek By Jowl 
10. The Spit

Catalogue Number: CAC005 
UPC: 0680569847959

name: Finn LeMarinel - Garden (Digital Single)
description:
Release Date: 13/05/2013

Having sold out the initial run of his critically acclaimed debut record Violence with Scottish indie heroes RM Hubbert (Chemikal Underground) and John Williamson through their Glasgow based label Ubisano Records in October 2012, Comets & Cartwheels are excited to announce we’ll be taking on the incredible Finn LeMarinel this year for a more expansive release of the album across the UK and beyond. 

This campaign includes the release of 'Garden', the first single to be taken from the album. 

Order to receive a digital copy of the single and B-sides direct to your inbox on the day of release.

TRACK LISTING

1. Garden
2. Leak
3. Someone

Catalogue Number: CAC004

name: Finn LeMarinel - Violence (Digital Album)
description:
Release Date: October 2012

In support of our upcoming single releases with Finn, we are excited to add his stunning debut album as a new product in our store. Watch this space for a new run of physical copies. 

Order the digital version and receive digital tracks plus the album artwork. 

‘LeMarinel's solo debut is a glorious calling card of acoustic folk musicianship’ - The List

twitter.com/finnlm
facebook.com/finnlemarinel

TRACK LISTING

1. Garden
2. Roll the Grime
3. Close Enough to Part
4. Sown
5. Known Voices
6. Winter
7. Places Known 
8. The Mayor
9. Wrung
10. Only Child 
11. Is This All They Are
12. No-one

name: Fake Major - Have Plenty Of Fun (CD EP)
description: The long-awaited four track debut EP from Glasgow duo Fake Major. We'll mail you a physical EP. Release Date: 01/05/2013 Catalogue Number: CAC002 Band Information Fake Major got the year off to a bang, landing their infectious and rather beautiful track ‘Little Researcher’ (produced by Andy Bush and mastered by Chvrches member Iain Cook) in February, complete with equally beguiling video by our good friends Precious Productions. The track was well received, with DJs Ally McCrae and Vic Galloway giving it a spin on their respective BBC Radio shows. The band are now looking forward to the release of this, their debut EP, Have Plenty Of in April 2013, and completed their first UK tour in March 2013. www.fakemajor.com

name: Fake Major - Have Plenty of Fun (Digital EP)
description:
The long-awaited four track debut EP from Glasgow duo Fake Major. 
Get the digital version of the EP delivered straight to your inbox.

Release Date: 01/05/2013 
Catalogue Number: CAC002

Band Information

Fake Major got the year off to a bang, landing their infectious and rather beautiful track ‘Little Researcher’ (produced by Andy Bush and mastered by Chvrches member Iain Cook) in February, complete with equally beguiling video by our good friends Precious Productions.

The track was well received, with DJs Ally McCrae and Vic Galloway giving it a spin on their respective BBC Radio shows. The band are now looking forward to the release of this, their debut EP, Have Plenty Of in 
April 2013, and completed their first UK tour in March 2013.

www.fakemajor.com
